author: aberkie
content: If ethereum 2.0 is out-dated terminology why does ethereum.org still use it?

author: djrtwo
content: it becomes out of date from the perspective of users as we go through the Merge. There are plans to revamp the terminology soon

author: djrtwo
content:
step one was to get all the repos changed and devs aligned on terminology as we work on the merge

now that will ripple outwrad more and more as the merge approaches

author: timbeiko
content: As for ethereum.org, a bit concern is also SEO: it is the main destination for searches related to "Ethereum 2.0", and changing the terminology would affect that. This means the change will have to be more gradual and over a longer period of time.

author: djrtwo
content: yeah, if you create a vacuum, less informative (or misinformative) sites would take over that search term
